oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ATTENUATION OF WAVE INDUCED OSCILLATION IN PORTS BY IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS AT THE HARBOR ENTRANCE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kubo, M.
Aoki, S.
Segura, J.J. Avitia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave attenuation
wave induced oscillation
harbor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The authors developed the numerical method to calculate the wave height distribution around a pair of breakwaters with arbitrary shape of the edge. The effect of the resonators equipped in the breakwaters on the diffracted wave height is simulated by using this method. Simulated results show that the resonators have remarkable effect to reduce wave heights in a harbor. However, in the experiments, resonators are not so effective as predicted by the theory.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 196
